# Who am I?

-   PostDoc at MedUni Vienna and the Complexity Science Hub
-   Psychology, Neuroscience, Data Science
-   Research topics: social media, misinformation, mental health, suicide prevention

# Intention

-   For beginners
-   Encourage you to start writing your analyses as code
-   Reproducibility & transparency for yourself and others
-   Break things down to lower the barrier
-   A big welcome to all your doubts and questions!
    -   Please interrupt any time
    -   Especially if you feel your question might be stupid
-   Making mistakes is essential for learning to code.

# Course overview

-   Wednesdays 10am-12pm: March 6, 13, 20 & 27, 2024
-   Time schedule: Break from 11h to 11h10
-   All materials: <https://hannahmetzler.eu/R_intro/> (or at the [Source](https://github.com/hannahmetzler/R_intro/) on Github)
-   Lesson 1: Getting started
-   Later lessons: Data visualizations, data wrangling, basic statistics
-   8 hours are not much - so I focus on keeping you all on board, you can easily continue learning online.

# Before we start

-   Have all of you managed to install R & Rstudio?
-   How do you feel about learning R in one word?
    -   Shy/excited/under-confident/brave/bored?
-   Previous experience in 1-2 words?
    -   none/very little/little?

# To follow the course

-   Open R studio
-   Either Zoom or lesson materials on the side
-   Write code **yourself** as we go along to practice.
    -   You'll learn more if you get errors!
-   If in hurry: Code fields from materials can be copied by click
